title: Phyllanthopsis arida
text:
Phyllanthopsis arida, the trans-Pecos maidenbush, is a rare plant species endemic to western Texas.
"Phyllanthopsis arida" is a thornless, <a href="dioecious">dioecious</a>, <a href="deciduous">deciduous</a>, highly branching shrub up to 100 cm tall. Leaves are ovate to obovate, up to 1.0 cm long. Flower solitary or in small clusters, yellow-green, up to 3 mm in diameter. <a href="Capsule%20%28botany%29">Capsule</a> is hanging, up to 7 mm long.
